title: Forging his chains.
author: Bidwell, George.
snippet: The couple next opened shop at No. 62 Broadway, and transacted business under the name of "W. A. Stewart. While here Hayes (now Stewart) bought $600 worth of furs of Mr. M. M. Backus, of No. 532 Broadway, and gave him a worthless check therefor; bought $500 worth of cloths of Messrs. Abernethy & Co., of No. 23 Warren street, and gave that firm a worthless check; purchased wagons valued at $585 of Messrs. Brewster & Baldwin, of Broadway and Tenth Street, and defrauded them, and many other tradesmen whose names have not been made known. The business  was next resumed at No. 81 Beaver Street, and there the chief was known as Wallace.
